sentences.en: He told the tribunal his career had "taken a nosedive" since his dismissal last year.
sentences.cn: 他告诉仲裁委员会，自去年被解雇以来，他的职业生涯就陷入了低谷。

sentences.en: His acting career took a nosedive and he turned to drink for solace.
sentences.cn: 演艺事业突然一落千丈,他便借酒浇愁.

sentences.en: His career took a nosedive and he turned to drink and drugs for solace.
sentences.cn: 他的事业一落千丈,开始酗酒吸毒以寻求慰借.

sentences.en: It is said by the specialists that the Japanese yen would nosedive further.
sentences.cn: 据专家分析说,今后日元还将持续暴跌.

sentences.en: Oil prices took a nosedive in the crisis.
sentences.cn: 危机期间，石油价格暴跌。
自1月份以来销售额骤降。

sentences.en: That means all property values are going to nosedive until they are sold.
sentences.cn: 这意味着所有属性值都将急转直下,直到它们被出售.

sentences.en: The bank yesterday revealed a 30 per cent nosedive in profits.
sentences.cn: 该银行昨天透露其利润骤降30％。

sentences.en: The economy went into a nosedive.
The last part of the controlled descent will be a nosedive into the ground.
sentences.cn: 朝着地面俯冲是控制降落的最后环节.

sentences.en: The plane went into a nosedive.
The pound took a nosedive on the foreign exchange market today.
sentences.cn: 英镑今天在外汇交易市场上出现暴跌。

sentences.en: The value of other shares nosedived by $2.6 billion.
sentences.cn: 其他股票市值暴跌了26亿美元。

sentences.en: We were all terrified when the pilot took the plane into a nosedive.
sentences.cn: 当飞行员将飞机垂直俯冲下去时,我们都给吓坏了.

sentences.en: Yet most are still more concerned that the economy could yet nosedive as credit becomes scarcer.
sentences.cn: 不过,大多数人所关注的仍然是在信贷较困难的情况下,经济可能还会暴跌.

words.tran_cn: （价格等的）急降，暴跌；（飞机的）俯冲；（名声）低落；（情况）突然变坏

trans.tran_cn: 急剧下降，急转直下，暴跌，（飞行器的）俯冲
trans.tran_en: a sudden very large fall in the price, value, or condition of something
a sudden very large fall in the price, value, or condition of something
if a plane nosedives, it drops suddenly and steeply with its front end pointing towards the ground

trans.tran_cn: （价格、费用等）骤降，急剧下跌，（飞行器）俯冲
